qas.question: What are the 1988 demonstrations in Burma called?
Who lead the government coup in 1988 ?
Why was marshal law declared in Burma in 1989?

answers.text: declared martial law after widespread protests.

qas.question: What was the official name of Burma changed to by the State Law and Order Restoration Council (SLORC)
Have elections been held in Burma since the military coup in 1988 ?

answers.text: The military government finalised plans for People's Assembly elections on 31 May 1989

context: In 1988, unrest over economic mismanagement and political oppression by the government led to widespread pro-democracy demonstrations throughout the country known as the <a0_0>8888 Uprising<a0_0/>. Security forces killed thousands of demonstrators, and <a1_0>General Saw Maung<a1_0/> staged a coup d'état and formed the State Law and Order Restoration Council (SLORC). In 1989, SLORC <a2_0>declared martial law after widespread protests.<a2_0/> <a4_0>The military government finalised plans for People's Assembly elections on 31 May 1989<a4_0/>. SLORC changed the country's official English name from the "Socialist Republic of the Union of Burma" to the "<a3_0>Union of Myanmar<a3_0/>" in 1989.
